info.title: ProvisioningServiceClient
info.description: API for service operations with the Azure IoT Hub Device Provisioning Service

get.summary: Get a certificate authority. This operation requires the certificateAuthorities/read permission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The certificate authority id. A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

ETag.description: The ETag of the resource to update.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

put.summary: Create or replace a certificate authority with the specified certificate authority source type. This operation requires the certificateAuthorities/write permission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The desired certificate authority name. A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag of the certificate authority.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

delete.summary: Delete the certificate authority. This operation requires the certificateAuthorities/delete permission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The certificate authority name. A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag of the certificate authority.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This id is used to uniquely identify a device registration of an enrollment. A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

parameters.description: The ETag of the enrollment record.

get.summary: Get a specific trust bundle and it contents.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The trust bundle id. A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

put.summary: Create or update a trust bundle.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The trust bundle id. A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag of the trust bundle.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

delete.summary: Delete the trust bundle. This operation requires the trustBundle/delete permission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The trust bundle id. A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag of the trust bundle record.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

post.summary: Retrieves a list of the certificate authorities and a continuation token to retrieve the next page. This operation requires the certificateAuthorities/read permission.

x-ms-continuation.description: The continuation token for getting the next page of results.

x-ms-max-item-count.description: The maximum number of items returned in a page.

x-ms-item-type.description: The list of values returned from the query.

ProvisioningServiceErrorDetails.description: Contains the properties of an error returned by the Azure IoT Hub Provisioning Service.

id.description:
The certificate authority identifier. A case-insensitive string (up to 64 characters long) of ASCII 7-bit alphanumeric
characters plus certain special characters . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

createdDateTimeUtc.description: The DateTime this resource was created in UTC.

lastUpdatedDateTimeUtc.description: The DateTime this resource was last updated in UTC.

etag.description: The ETag of the device record.

certificates.description: The certificates affiliated with this Certificate Authority.

registrationId.description:
This id is used to uniquely identify a device registration of an enrollment.
A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

attestation.description: Attestation method used by the device.

deviceHostname.description:
Hostname of the device (optional). Will be lower-cased.
Must adhere to the domain name spec: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1035.

deviceIpAddress.description:
IP address of the device (optional).
This can be an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

etag.description: The entity tag associated with the resource.

reprovisionPolicy.description: The behavior when a device is re-provisioned to an IoT hub.

createdDateTimeUtc.description: The DateTime this resource was created.

lastUpdatedDateTimeUtc.description: The DateTime this resource was last updated.

allocationPolicy.description: The allocation policy of this resource. This policy overrides the tenant level allocation policy for this individual enrollment or enrollment group. Possible values include 'hashed': Linked IoT hubs are equally likely to have devices provisioned to them, 'geoLatency':  Devices are provisioned to an IoT hub with the lowest latency to the device.If multiple linked IoT hubs would provide the same lowest latency, the provisioning service hashes devices across those hubs, 'static' : Specification of the desired IoT hub in the enrollment list takes priority over the service-level allocation policy, 'custom': Devices are provisioned to an IoT hub based on your own custom logic. The provisioning service passes information about the device to the logic, and the logic returns the desired IoT hub as well as the desired initial configuration. We recommend using Azure Functions to host your logic.

iotHubs.description: The list of IoT Hub hostnames the device(s) in this resource can be allocated to. Must be a subset of tenant level list of IoT hubs.

customAllocationDefinition.description: This tells DPS which webhook to call when using custom allocation.

trustBundleId.description: Optional trust bundle id to associate with the enrollment.

clientCertificateIssuancePolicy.description: Certificate issuance policy for device client certificates.

serverCertificateIssuancePolicy.description: Certificate issuance policy for device server certificates.

registrationId.description:
This id is used to uniquely identify a device registration of an enrollment.
A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

substatus.description: Substatus for 'Assigned' devices. Possible values include - 'initialAssignment': Device has been assigned to an IoT hub for the first time, 'deviceDataMigrated': Device has been assigned to a different IoT hub and its device data was migrated from the previously assigned IoT hub. Device data was removed from the previously assigned IoT hub, 'deviceDataReset':  Device has been assigned to a different IoT hub and its device data was populated from the initial state stored in the enrollment. Device data was removed from the previously assigned IoT hub, 'reprovisionedToInitialAssignment': Device has been re-provisioned to a previously assigned IoT hub.

errorCode.description: An integer representation of the error code. For details regarding the error codes please see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-dps/how-to-troubleshoot-dps#common-error-codes

errorMessage.description: A description of the error details as a string.

etag.description: The entity tag associated with the resource as a string.

payload.description: Custom allocation payload returned from the webhook to the device.

trustBundle.description: The optional trust bundle result returned after a successful device registration.

issuedClientCertificate.description: Client certificate issued to the device in PEM format.

deviceCertificateIssuanceSettings.description: Certificate issuance settings specification for the device.

deviceHostname.description: Optional configured hostname for the device.

deviceIpAddress.description: Optional configured IP address for the device.

AttestationMechanism.description: Attestation mechanism for individualEnrollment as well as enrollmentGroup.

iotEdge.description: If set to true, this device is an IoTEdge device.

InitialTwin.description: Initial device twin. Contains a subset of the properties of Twin.

ReprovisionPolicy.description: The behavior of the service when a device is re-provisioned to an IoT hub.

updateHubAssignment.description: When set to true (default), the Device Provisioning Service will evaluate the device's IoT Hub assignment and update it if necessary for any provisioning requests beyond the first from a given device. If set to false, the device will stay assigned to its current IoT hub.

migrateDeviceData.description: When set to true (default), the Device Provisioning Service will migrate the device's data (twin, device capabilities, and device ID) from one IoT hub to another during an IoT hub assignment update. If set to false, the Device Provisioning Service will reset the device's data to the initial desired configuration stored in the corresponding enrollment list.

CustomAllocationDefinition.description: This tells DPS which webhook to call when using custom allocation.

webhookUrl.description: The webhook URL used for allocation requests.

apiVersion.description: The API version of the provisioning service types (such as IndividualEnrollment) sent in the custom allocation request. Minimum supported version: "2018-09-01-preview".

certificateAuthorityName.description: Certificate authority name used to issue certificates.

TrustBundle.description: A collection of trusted root or intermediate certificates associated with one or more device enrollments.

certificates.description: The certificates in the trust bundle.

id.description: The trust bundle ID. A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

createdDateTime.description: The DateTime this resource was created in UTC.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The DateTime this resource was last updated in UTC.

etag.description: The ETag of the trust bundle.

certificateIssuanceEndpoint.description: Certificate issuance endpoint which devices can access

InitialTwinProperties.description: Represents the initial properties that will be set on the device twin.

desired.description: Gets and sets the InitialTwin desired properties.

certificate.description:
Certificates in PEM format enclosed within these headers:
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
-----END CERTIFICATE-----

sha1Thumbprint.description: SHA-1 hash value of the certificate as a hexadecimal string.

sha256Thumbprint.description: SHA-256 hash value of the certificate as a hexadecimal string.

notBeforeUtc.description: The date on which the certificate becomes valid.

notAfterUtc.description: The date on which the certificate is no longer valid.

attestation.description: Attestation method used by the device.

etag.description: The entity tag associated with the resource.

reprovisionPolicy.description: The behavior when a device is re-provisioned to an IoT hub.

createdDateTimeUtc.description: The DateTime this resource was created.

lastUpdatedDateTimeUtc.description: The DateTime this resource was last updated.

allocationPolicy.description: The allocation policy of this resource. This policy overrides the tenant level allocation policy for this individual enrollment or enrollment group. Possible values include 'hashed': Linked IoT hubs are equally likely to have devices provisioned to them, 'geoLatency':  Devices are provisioned to an IoT hub with the lowest latency to the device.If multiple linked IoT hubs would provide the same lowest latency, the provisioning service hashes devices across those hubs, 'static' : Specification of the desired IoT hub in the enrollment list takes priority over the service-level allocation policy, 'custom': Devices are provisioned to an IoT hub based on your own custom logic. The provisioning service passes information about the device to the logic, and the logic returns the desired IoT hub as well as the desired initial configuration. We recommend using Azure Functions to host your logic.

iotHubs.description: The list of IoT Hub hostnames the device(s) in this resource can be allocated to. Must be a subset of tenant level list of IoT hubs.

customAllocationDefinition.description: This tells DPS which webhook to call when using custom allocation.

trustBundleId.description: Optional trust bundle id to associate with the enrollment.

clientCertificateIssuancePolicy.description: Certificate issuance policy for device client certificates.

serverCertificateIssuancePolicy.description: Certificate issuance policy for device server certificates.

BulkEnrollmentOperationResult.description: Results of a bulk enrollment operation

isSuccessful.description: Indicates if the operation was successful in its entirety.

registrationId.description:
This id is used to uniquely identify a device registration of an enrollment.
A case-insensitive string (up to 128 characters long) of alphanumeric characters plus certain special characters : . _ -. No special characters allowed at start or end.

BulkEnrollmentGroupOperationResult.description: Results of a bulk enrollment group operation.

isSuccessful.description: Indicates if the operation was successful in its entirety.

TwinCollection.description: Represents a collection of properties within a Twin

count.description: Number of properties in the TwinCollection

lastUpdated.description: Last time the TwinCollection was updated

lastUpdatedVersion.description: This is null for reported properties metadata and is not null for desired properties metadata.

profileName.description: The customer specific DigiCert certificate authority profile name needed to identify their issuing CA instance.

apiKey.description: The API key required to authenticate with DigiCert.
The customer specific GlobalSign certificate authority API key needed to identify their issuing CA instance.

apiSecret.description: The API secret required to authenticate with GlobalSign.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for the request. Supported versions include: 2021-11-01-preview
